702111f.text:
Jestchester Avenue (foreground ), north side, from
Boynton Avenue (right) to Peeler Avenue, showing part
2 of a panoramic vi-w of the iatson estate. On the rioh t,
in front of which foynton Avenue was Piter laid out, is
the sur otuous Vatson Mansion. The estate is being level-
ed out for the laving of public thoroughfares and future
residentiaJ development. The dirt road on the left is

toward West Farms Road. It later became Wheeler Avenue.

700559f-a.title: Bronx: Boyton Avenue - Westchester Avenue
700559f-a.text:
Boynton Ave., east side, between Westchester Ave. and East 172nd
Street, showing the Watson Mansion on the William Watson estate. The
G.W. Bromley map of 1913 ahows the mansion no longer to be there and its
site to be occupied (1927,map) by 2-story brick dwellings.
1911.
Gift of Randall Comfort.

700558f-a.title: Bronx: Boyton Avenue - Westchester Avenue
700558f-a.text:
1204 to 1226 Boynton Ave. (from fore to background), at, adjoining
and north of the N.E. corner of Westchester Ave. Also shown (left) is
No. 1537-1539 Westchester Ave., at the N.W. corner of Boynton Ave.
June 1915.
James Suydam.
